title: ARCHETYPE_ID
description:
Identifier for archetypes. Ideally these would identify globally unique archetypes.
Lexical form: `rm_originator  '-' rm_name  '-' rm_entity  '.' concept_name {  '-' specialisation }*  '.v' number`.
$comments: Defined in Base_types IM, inherits from OBJECT_ID

value.description: The value of the id in the form defined below.

qualified_rm_entity.description: Globally qualified reference model entity, e.g.  `openehr-EHR-OBSERVATION`.

domain_concept.description: Name of the concept represented by this archetype, including specialisation, e.g. `Biochemistry_result-cholesterol`.

rm_originator.description: Organisation originating the reference model on which this archetype is based, e.g. openehr,  cen,  hl7 .

rm_name.description: Name of the reference model, e.g. rim,  ehr_rm,  en13606 .

rm_entity.description: Name of the ontological level within the reference model to which this archetype is targeted, e.g. for openEHR,  folder ,  composition ,  section ,  entry .

specialisation.description: Name of specialisation of concept, if this archetype is a specialisation of another archetype, e.g.  cholesterol .
